name: Bot - E-commerce Action Figure
description_short: Bot compares action figure price and shipping by accessing E-commerce.
description: This bot accesses an E-commerce page, looks for an action figure and extracts their respective prices and shipping. After finishing, creates a spreadsheet with collected data.

name: SpotiBot - Spotify Automation
description_short: The bot makes automatic login in spotify, mutes ads and tries to skip them
description: SpotiBot is a automation for muting and skipping ads. You can use it as template to try to create your own spotify automation. Makes automatically login before starts to muting

name: IBGEBot
description_short: Bot to access the IBGE website and download data in Excel format from the chosen location
description: Automation using BotCity FrameWork, which works with computer vision, was developed for the Rocketseat Scholarships challenge at the #DoWhile event. Simple automation to access the IBGE website and download data in Excel format from the chosen location.

name: Bot - RPA Challenge - Input Forms
description_short: This bot will solve the Input Forms challenge available at https://www.rpachallenge.com/.
description: This bot will solve the Input Forms challenge available at https://www.rpachallenge.com/ using two different strategies. The first is the straightfoward way, while the second is a bit more creative.

name: Bot - RPA Challenge - Invoice Extraction
description_short: This bot will solve the Invoice Extraction challenge available at https://rpachallengeocr.azurewebsites.net/
description: This bot will solve the Invoice Extraction challenge available at https://rpachallengeocr.azurewebsites.net/. This bot uses OCR and Concurrent_computing

name: Bot - Image Editor
description_short: This is a bot that operates the online image editor found at https://pixlr.com/
description: This is a bot that operates the online image editor found at https://pixlr.com/. It uses Botcity's Web Bot

name: Bot - Spreadsheet
description_short: This is a bot that fills up a spreadsheet with the data that comes from an API
description: This bot takes from an API (https://www.themoviedb.org/) the most popular movies as data and turns it into a spreadsheet, so human can read and parse the data.

description_short: The robot for searching domains at Godaddy and Google domains.

description: This bot accesses three different ecomerce pages, looks for a particular cell phone model and extracts their respective prices and shipping. After you finish, create a spreadsheet with the collected data.

description: This headless bot fetches the rating from Metacritic and stores it in a .xlsx file

name: Wordle Bot
description_short: This is a bot that plays the game Wordle, albeit in its alternative version called Hello Wordle.
description: This is a bot that plays the game Wordle, albeit in its alternative version called Hello Wordle. This version allows you to play as many times a day as you want, and to change the word size to a number between 4 and 11. As a demonstration, this bot plays once for every word size, starting at 11.

description_short: Fetch list of IPs from http://free-proxy-list.net/.
description: Fetch list of IPs from http://free-proxy-list.net/.

description_short: This bot solves the Letreco game, the brazilian version of Wordle.
description: This bot solves the Letreco game, the brazilian version of Wordle.

description_short: This bot shows an example of automation in Android environments through an emulator.
description: This bot shows an example of automation in Android environments through an emulator.

description_short: RPA Bot to capture cashback values in 'Méliuz' and 'Banco Inter' websites, for selected stores.
description: RPA Bot to capture cashback values in 'Méliuz' and 'Banco Inter' websites, for selected stores. Developed in Python with BotCity

name: Bot - Gold
description_short: A bot that checks the value of gold in BRL today and shows that value to the user
description: The bot is responsible to enter in https://dolarhoje.com/ouro-hoje/, get the value of 1g of gold in BRL and prints this value to user.

name: Instagram Bot
description_short: This bot can be used to automacaitally 'like' up to 6 Instagram stories.
description: This automation access Instagram, assuming that the username and password are already saved and the browser is already open. The first story on the list is open, the bot hits the like button and closes the page. The main webpage is reloaded and the process is repeated until the counter reaches the maximum number of 6 stores (the counter goes from 0 to 5)

name: Whatsapp Bot
description_short: The robot checks the student transport card balance via Whatsapp.
description: Developed in Python with BotCity Studio. This automation access WhatsApp and interacts with another bot added to the contacts to check the balance available on the student transport card.

name: BotCertificates
description_short: This automation interacts with an excel spreadsheet, checking if the Process column is empty, if it is, it does the procedure of creating a certificate, opening the power point, and putting the name data based on the spreadsheet, and current date, through datetime library, after, saves file as PDF.
description: This automation interacts with an excel spreadsheet, checking if the Process column is empty, if it is, it does the procedure of creating a certificate, opening the power point, and putting the name data based on the spreadsheet, and current date, through datetime library, after, saves file as PDF.

name: BotCity Instagram ChatGpt
description_short: Instagram content publisher using ChatGPT and Google Images

name: RPA Challenge - With BotCity
description_short: The RPA Challenge consists of accessing a website and downloading a spreadsheet with employee data. After that, insert the data read from the spreadsheet into the respective fields on the website and send. However, the fields change position with each send, making the process more difficult.
description: This challenge aims to create a workflow where the robot accesses the website 'https://rpachallenge.com' and downloads the indicated spreadsheet. After that, insert the data from the spreadsheet into their respective fields and send. However, the fields change position after each submission over ten rounds, so the robot must correctly identify where to enter the spreadsheet records

name: Work Items
description_short: Extract data from Acme System.
description: The automation accesses the ACME System website to extract all work items and saves them in the MySQL Workbench database. Then, it sends an email informing the user.

name: Bitwarden vault and WebBot
description_short: Example of using Bitwarden with WebBot to fill out forms.
description: This automation loads some secrets in the Bitwarden vault and uses them to fill the form. I used a web bot template from BotCity, accessing DOM elements. You must install Python, Pip, Virtualenv, and other dependencies described in the requirements file.

name: Web Form Filling
description_short: The automation collects data from an Excel spreadsheet, then opens the form in the browser and fills it with the collected data.
description: This automation was created to simplify the process of filling out online forms. It uses the Python RPA library to interact with graphical interface elements, quickly and accurately populating fields with specific data.

name: OrangeHRM login with Twilio WhatsApp
description_short: Automation that connects the login process with WhatsApp.
description: This automation sends an alert to WhatsApp about the start of the login process and requests the username and password to authenticate the login.

name: Web bot with Gmail and Google Sheets
description_short: This automation reads the zip codes received, consults them, saves the information in a spreadsheet, and sends an email to notify anyone involved.
description: The RPA automation project was developed with Python using the BotCity framework to read zip codes, consults the Correios do Brasil website, saves the information in a Google Sheets spreadsheet, and sends an email to notify that the registration executed well.

name: BotInfomoney
description_short: The automation collects information on the Infomoney website, searches the index and shares value on Google finance, and generates a demonstrative spreadsheet.
description: The automation collects information on the most significant rises in the stock market through the Infomoney website, searches the index and value of shares on Google Finance, and generates a demonstrative spreadsheet.

name: Bot: Product Registration
description_short: The automation registers products in a desktop system called Fakturama.
description: The automation registers products from a JSON file in a desktop system called Fakturama, using Python and computer vision. Then, it sends an alert to the BotCity Orchestrator and registers a log about the product.

name: Top Stocks B3
description_short: A small algorithm that extracts and filters current stocks on the Brazilian stock exchange (B3).
description: Automation that extracts and filters current stocks on the Brazilian stock exchange (B3) based on data from the fundamentus.com.br website that correspond to the following criteria: P/E between 3 and 10; P/BV between 0.5 and 2; Dividend Yield between 7% and 14%; ROE between 15% and 30%; Liquidity greater than 1M.

name: RPAChallenge_UiPathREFrameworkStructure
description_short: Solve the RPA challenge using a structure similar to the UiPath REFramework.
description: This is an automation that fills in the RPA Challenge form based on information from Excel. It is made based on the structure/project template from the UiPath REFramework, applying its process in a basic way.

name: Bot: dev.to analysis
description_short: The automation scrapes the dev.to website, fetching data from the week's most popular articles, and generates a CSV with this information.
description: The automation performs web scraping on the dev.to website, extracting data from the week's most popular articles, such as title, number of reactions, comments, and tags and generates a CSV with this data. It then creates a dashboard using Streamlit with the data obtained from the website.

name: Automation of New Product Registration in ERP Fakturama with BotCity
description_short: This automation is a Python script that automates product registration in the Fakturama ERP using BotCity Desktop Bot and Computer Vision. We could automatically fill in the system screens by extracting data from a JSON file, optimizing the workflow, and minimizing manual errors.
description: Data Extraction: Product information was extracted from a JSON file. Registration Automation: We used BotCity and Computer Vision to fill out the Fakturama fields. Testing and Validation: Tests were performed to ensure the products were entered correctly into the system.

name: BOT PDF Data Extractor & Email Sender
description_short: Bot to automatically extract specific information from PDF files, transfer this data to an Excel spreadsheet, and send the generated report by email.
description: Develop a Python bot capable of extracting specific data from a fictitious PDF file, organizing this information in an Excel spreadsheet, and sending the report via email in an automated manner.

name: DataBot-19
description_short: DataBot-19 is an automated bot created to collect data on COVID-19 using the Our World in Data API. It downloads information about cases and deaths in Brazil over the last seven days, stores this data in Google Sheets, and generates visual graphics using the Matplotlib library.
description: DataBot-19 is a project developed by the Linus team to automate the collection and analysis of COVID-19 data. This bot, created with Python and BotCity, connects to the Our World in Data (OWID) API, eliminating the need for manual downloads of CSV files. Instead, DataBot-19 collects and processes updated data directly from the API, prioritizing specific information for Brazil and focusing on data from the last seven days. Main Features: Data Download and Processing Automation: The bot accesses the OWID API, downloads data on COVID-19 cases and deaths, and applies filtering to ensure the extraction of the most relevant data for Brazil, focusing on the most recent 7 days. This approach provides accuracy and efficiency in tracking the evolution of the pandemic. Storage in Google Sheets: DataBot-19 automatically stores the filtered data in a Google Sheets spreadsheet after collection and processing. This facilitates access and sharing of information among the team and other interested parties, allowing for quick and organized visualization. Graph Generation: The bot creates visual graphs that illustrate the daily evolution of cases and deaths using the Matplotlib library. These graphs are ideal for quick analysis and visual interpretation, allowing users to understand the pandemic trends in Brazil clearly.
